entry.title: The Lean Startup by Eric Ries
entry.summary:
I recently finished reading The Lean Startup by Eric Ries. These are my thoughts on the book.

Primary concepts I took away:

  1. The power of small batch sizes reduces waste by minimizing the building of unwanted features. Also enables constant feedback by customers
  2. Use learning as a measure of progress for highly uncertain ventures such as new start up companies
  3. Follow a Build-Measure-Learn feedback loop driven by Minimum Viable Product (MVP) and continual small iterations
